intro: Pyrus alaunica, commonly known as the alpine pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are typically edible but not widely cultivated. Pyrus alaunica is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude environments.
